abstract.p: Susan Siegel letter warns of higher on-line prices for out-of-print books, and notes that there are millions more titles available through actually dealers (S)

block.p: In addition to often paying higher prices when they buy out-of-print books online (News Watch, ''Find Old Books on the Web, Then Prepare to Pay the Price,'' June 8) book buyers should also know that the online listings represent only the tip of the iceberg.

According to figures compiled by my company, Book Hunter Press, there are more than 7,900 used-book dealers in the United States and Canada with an inventory of more than 190 million books. Of that number, only about 20 million books, or 10 percent of the total available inventory, are listed online.
